titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Geoffrey White Papers, 1939-1965
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2000 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, reports, resolutions, minutes, discussion bulletins, and printed matter, relating to American Trotskyist politics, the Socialist Workers Party, and the formation of the Spartacist League. Includes a few items relating to the Communist Party of the United States and the Independent Socialist League.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Geoffrey White Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1978.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Joined the Communist Party of the United States
Resigned from the Communist Party and subsequently joined the Socialist Workers' Party
Supported James Robertson who split the Socialist Workers' Party and established a new Marxist group, Spartacist

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: Communist Party of the United States of America.
controlaccess.subject: Communism.
Communism--United States.
Socialism--United States.

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

Analysis, announcements, bibliography, bulletins, chronology, clippings, declarations, drafts of resolutions, leaflets, letters, maps, memoranda, minutes, notes, ordinances, outline of a speech, petitions, proposed agenda of a meeting, reports, resolutions, statements, statistics, statutes, summary of a discussion, theses, typed copies of magazine articles. Arranged alphabetically by subject.
Mimeographed discussion and internal bulletins, printed matter. Arranged alphabetically by issuing agency.
